settings.title: Meet the Artist
settings.text:
In my Lake Stevens studio I produce about 50–70 pieces per month. Each mug, bowl, and plate is hand-thrown, glazed, and fired one by one, ensuring each is truly unique. Working in small batches lets me focus on form and finish while keeping my work personal and intentional.

I fire my kiln about once a month, producing a limited collection of work each time. What you see here is what's fresh from the latest firing.

settings.title: The Process
settings.text:
Most months I throw and glaze about 50 pieces, which I list here as they come out of the kiln. Each piece begins on the pottery wheel, where I shape the clay by hand. After drying, I apply glazes that I've developed over years of experimentation.

The firing process takes place in my electric kiln, reaching temperatures of over 2000°F. This transforms the clay and glaze into durable, beautiful ceramics ready for everyday use.
